caption.center: J.K.S., Appellant, v. STATE OF FLORIDA, Appellee.

court.center: District Court of Appeal of Florida, Second District.

opinion.posture: Appeal from the Circuit Court for Hillsborough County; D. Michelle Sisco, Judge.
opinion.attorneys:
James Marion Moorman, Public Defender, and Timothy J. Ferreri, Assistant Public Defender, Bartow, for Appellant.
Bill McCollum, Attorney General, Tallahassee, and Dale E. Tarpley, Assistant Attorney General, Tampa, for Appellee.
opinion.opinion_text:
Affirmed. See Reyes v. State, 952 So. 2d 1262, 1265 (Fla. 2d DCA 2007) ("`It is well settled that the specific legal ground upon which a claim is based must be raised at trial and a claim different than that raised below will not be heard on appeal.'" (quoting Rodriguez v. State,609 So. 2d 493, 499 (Fla. 1992))). CANADY and LaROSE, JJ., and LEVY, DAVID L., ASSOCIATE SENIOR JUDGE, Concur.
NOT FINAL UNTIL TIME EXPIRES TO FILE REHEARING MOTION AND, IF FILED, DETERMINED.
